Aphids: Suck plant sap causing stunted growth and yellowing leaves
Transmit viral diseases between plants rapidly
Armyworm: Devour entire crops overnight in large groups
Prefer corn, rice, and wheat crops
Beetles: Chew leaves and stems causing visible damage
Some species bore into plant stems killing the plant
Caterpillars: Feed on leaves reducing photosynthesis capacity
Can completely defoliate plants if uncontrolled
Grasshoppers: Consume large amounts of foliage very quickly
Migrate in swarms destroying entire fields
Ladybugs: BENEFICIAL: Eat aphids and other pest insects
Natural pest control agents for gardens
Leafhoppers: Pierce plant tissues and suck out nutrients
Spread plant diseases like aster yellows
Mealybugs: Secrete honeydew attracting ants and causing mold
Weaken plants by feeding on sap continuously
Spider_mites: Create fine webbing while sucking plant juices
Cause leaf discoloration and eventually leaf drop
Thrips: Scrape plant surfaces causing silvery streaks
Whiteflies: Excrete sticky honeydew leading to sooty mold
Bees: Increase crop yields through effective pollination
